titleStmt.title: Maṣḥafa gǝnzat “Book of the Funeral Ritual”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary:
I) Maṣḥafa gǝnzat “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 3ra-84rb) - Discourse of St Athanasius on death (fols. 15ra-17vb) - Maṣḥaf za-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyarusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 17vb-23rb) - Mangada samāy “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 26va-38vb) - Homily by ʾabbā Salāmā, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 40rb-42rb) - Homily by St Jacob of Serug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 62vb-66rb) - Lǝfāfa ṣǝdq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (fols. 73vb-77vb) - Antiphons (Kǝśtata ʾaryām, mawāśǝʾt) performed for the funeral of different categories of Christians (fols. 79ra-80vb) - Burāke za-ʾanǝst “Benediction of women” (fols. 83ra-84rb)
Additiones 1-3.

msItem.note: - I) Maṣḥafa gǝnzat “Book of the Funeral Ritual”
I-1) Ṣalota ʿǝṭān “Ritual of the Incense” (3ra-10vb)
I-2) Admonition to be read over all the dead (11ra-14vb)
I-3) Discourse of St Athanasius on death (15ra-17vb)
I-4) Maṣḥaf za-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyarusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (17vb-23rb)
I-5) Laʿlä kʷǝllomu mǝwwǝtan, Reading over all the dead (23va-26va);
I-6) Mangada samāy “Journey to Heaven” (26va-38vb)
I-7) Prayer of penitence that God gave to Peter (38vb-39vb)
I-8) Anonymous homily on burial (39vb-40rb)
I-9) Homily by ʾabbā salāma, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (40rb-42rb)

I-10) Burial ritual for: metropolitans (42rb-43ra); qomosat (43ra-44rb); priests (44rb-45va); deacons (45va-46vb); monks (46vb-48rb); young fathers (48rb-49vb); children (49vb-51ra); nuns (51ra-51vb); old women (51vb-52vb); little girls (52vb-53vb);

I-11) Readings: on the day when the person died (53vb-55ra); on the third day (55rb-56ra); on the seventh day (56ra-56vb); on the twelfth day (56vb-57vb); on the thirtieth day (57vb-58vb); on the fortieth, sixtieth and eightieth days, and on the sixth month (58vb-62vb)
I-12) Homily of St Jacob of Sarug for the funeral of priests and deacons (62vb-66rb)
I-13) The story of the wealthy man who did not fear God (66rb-69ra)
I-14) Ṣalota nǝssǝḥa “Prayer of Penitence” (69ra-73vb)
I-15) Lǝfāfa ṣǝdǝq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (73vb-77vb)
I-16) Ṣalota burāke za-ʾabuna Sāmuʾel “Prayer of Benediction by ʾabuna Sāmuʾel” (77vb-79ra)
I-17) Short hymn and supplication (Kǝśtata ʾaryām with Musical notation), performed for the funeral of different categories of Christians (79ra-80vb)
I-18) Burāke za-ʾanǝst “Benediction of the woman” (83ra-84rb)
- Antiphons (Kǝśtata ʾaryām, mawāśǝʾt) contain interlineal musical signs.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 86.0 folios, of which blank 1v, 2r-v, 81r-v, 82r-v, 85r-v, 86r-v., in 12.0 quires (11+A).
293 220 60
supportDesc.condition: The Ms. is worn. The spine cover is missing. 38 is mutilated. Patched parchment hole: 46. Holes repaired: fols. 6, 9, 29, 39, 48, 75, 83.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote:
Mediocre, irregular Black, red (vivid vermilion) Walda Takla HāymānotWalda Takla Hāymānot is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula on 67rb. The scribe is different from that of Ms. AKM-003.19th century (?)
ስቡ፤ / ስ፤ ው፤ ወ፤ ው፤ ለ፤ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለአለም፡ (6vb, 7ra)
ይ፤ / ይባ፤ for ይባርክዎ፡ (6vb, 7ra)
ለእ፤ for ለእግዚአብሔር (6vb, 7ra)
ዝዕ፤ ዕ፤ ይ፤ በ፤ ተ፤ for ዝዕጣን፡ ይእርግ፡ በእንተ፡ (7va-vb, 8ra)
ን፤ እ፤ ወ፤ በ፤ for ንስዕለከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ወናስተበቁዓከ፡ በእንተ፡ (8vb, 9ra, 9vb)
ይ፤ ወ፤ ስ፤ ለእ፤ for ይትአኰት፡ ወይሴባሕ፡ ስሙ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ (10rb)
የ፤ ወ፤ እ፤ ወ፤ ስ፤ እ፤ for የአኵቱከ፡ ወይሴብሑከ፡ እኵት፡ ወስቡሕ፡ ስምከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ (10rb, 10va-vb)
ፍ፤ ለ፤ በ፤ / ፍ፤ ረ፤ ለ፤ በ፤ / ፍ፤ ረ፤ ለ፤ በ፤ በ፤ for ፍቱሐ ረስዮ ለዝንቱ በድን በአፈ (22ra, 22va-vb, 23ra-rb)
አ፤ ይ፤ እ፤ for አሜን፡ ይባርክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ (26rb)
ይ፡ ካ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., 27r, 29va, 31rb)
ይ፡ ዲ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., 27r, 27vb, 29va)
ይ፡ ሕ for ይበል፡ (29vb)
አ for አሜን (28rb, 33rb)
ቡ፡ ኩ፡ for ቡሩካነ፡ ኩኑ፡ (28rb)
ይእ፡ ወዘ፡ ወለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ይእዜኒ፡ ወዘልፈኒ፡ ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (29vb)
ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (30ra, 32rb)
ቅዱስ፡ ቅ፤ ቅ፤ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (31ra)
ሃ፤ ሉ፤ for ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡ (31ra)
ስረ፤ ሎ፤ ለገ፤ እ፤ for ስረይ፡ ሎቱ፡ ለገብርከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ (69vb, 70ra-rb, 70va-vb)
Nomina sacra; a few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) in the incipit page of the texts; two initial lines of each section; initial lines of Psalms; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; abbreviations alternating with letters in black (e.g., fols. 9ra, 22rb, 23ra); words, e.g., wa-yǝwgǝr ʿǝṭāna (fol. 8rb), wa-yǝʿud (fol. 8rb), täwäkäf (fol. 8va), ʾaʾakkwǝto (fol. 10ra-b), wa-yǝblu (e.g., fols. 18va, 19rb, 20ra), burāke (e.g., fols. 31vb, 33rb, 34rb); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

item.quote: 10vb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ አቡሁ፡ ተስፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ወስመ፡ እሙ፡ ወለተ፡ ሚካኤል፡፡
10vb: This book is of Walda Mikāʾel, his father is Tasfā Māryām and the name of his mother is Wälätta Mikāʾel.
item.note: The note is written in vivid scarlet, in the same hand as Additio 2 and the names in the supplication formulas.

item.quote: 84rb: ˂…˃ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ˂…˃፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ወልደ፡ ሚካኤል፡ አቡሁ፡ ተስፋ፡ ማርያም፡ ዓመተ፡ ሚካኤል፡፡
84rb: [This] book is of St Michael ˂…˃, which Walda Mikāʾel donated. His father is Tasfā Māryām [and his … is] ʿĀmata Mikāʾel.
item.note: The note is written in vivid scarlet, in the same hand as Additio 1 and the names in the supplication formulas.

item.quote: 84va: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘመድኃኒ፡ ዓለም፡ አዲግራት፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ዳግማዊ፡ ዘመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ዓመተ፡ ድንግል፡ ከመ፡ ይኵኖሙ፡ መርሃ፡ ለመንግስተ፡ ሰማያት፡፡
84va: This book is of ʾAddigrat Mädḫani ʿālam which Dagǝmawi Za-Manfas Qǝddus donated and his wife is ʿĀmata Dǝngǝl, so that it might be for them a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven.
item.note: The note is written in vivid scarlet, but in a finer hand, different from that of Additiones 1-2. It states that the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Za-Manfas Qǝddus whose wife is ʾAmata Dǝngǝl. The note states that the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Za-Manfas Qǝddus and his wife ʾAmata Dǝngǝl. The note is written in the same hand as the donation note in Ms. AMM-001 (s. Additio 2) and, most probably, the donation note in Mss. AMM-005, AMM-006.

list.item: - The title of the work, ግንዘት, is written in blue pen: 1r. - Tamallas-sign indicating the place where the omission, written in the margin, belong: 58rb. - Corrections written interlineally: 10rb, 10vb, 26ra, 38va, 71rb, 76va, 79ra. - Space for rubricated names left unfilled in the supplication formulas: 14ra, 64v. - A note, probably the original ownership or donation note, has been erased from 84rb. - A note, probably concerning donation, has been blotted out from 84va. - Pen trial: 10r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with light brown tooled leather (the spine cover is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.
One pair of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. A row of holes is visible on the spine folds of the quires, close to the tail of the codex.
Blind tooled ornament on the light brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: single circle, double line fillet, double sine wave with dots, criss cross).

origin.origDate: The Patriarch of Alexandria ( liqa ṗaṗṗasǝnä) ʾabbā Marqos (in tenure ) and Metropolitan (ṗaṗṗasǝnä) ʾabbā Matewos (in tenure ) and King Yoḥannǝs (r. ) are mentioned in the supplication formulas on 40rb.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the original donor has been erased from the supplication formulas and replaced with the names of Walda Mikāʾel, Tasfā Māryām and Wälätta Mikāʾel (e.g., 14vb, 38ra, 52vb), Walda Yoḥannǝs (e.g., 61vb), Gabra Ḥǝywot (e.g., 62ra), Kǝnfa Mikāʾel (e.g., 61va). The first three names are also mentioned in Additiones 1 and 2. All the names have been added by a secondary hand, in vivid scarlet. According to Additio 3, the Ms. was donated by Dagǝmawi Za-Manfas Qǝddus and his wife ʾAmata Dǝngǝl. Dagǝmawi Za-Manfas Qǝddus might be identified with the second son of daǧǧāzmāč Säbagadis (1770-1831), Ḫagos (d. 1831). The identification is based on Additiones 1 and 2 in Ms. FBM-002. He also donated Ms. FBM-009.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
